title: Assess environmental threaths
code: area <- sf::st_read(system.file("exdata/threat_example.kml", package = "urgenceAviR"), quiet = TRUE) |>   sf::st_transform(crs = sf::st_crs(32198))  mapview::mapviewOptions(fgb = FALSE) mapview::mapview(area) extent <- terra::ext(area)

title: Assess environmental threaths
code: species_ref <- urgenceAviR::get_species_codes(drop_subspecies = TRUE) #> ℹ Load 688 species from species reference table

title: Assess environmental threaths
text: Load SCF occurences data transform sf object Get occurences area
code: scf_occs <- urgenceAviR::load_all_datasets() |>   dplyr::filter(!is.na(latitude) & !is.na(longitude) & !is.na(abondance) & !is.na(date)) |>   sf::st_as_sf(coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = sf::st_crs(4326)) |>   sf::st_transform(scf_occs, crs = sf::st_crs(32198)) #>  #> ── Loading all datasets ────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Canards de mer ── #>  #> ℹ Starting what: Create one kernel by season and group of species
title: Assess environmental threaths
text: Split season Subset ducks group Rasterize abundances species group 95th quantile Plot raster values Run kernel season based observation points Reference: https://r-spatial.org/book/11-PointPattern.html https://www.paulamoraga.com/book-spatial/intensity-estimation.html
code: sscf_occs_area <- sscf_occs_area |> dplyr::mutate(   season = dplyr::case_when(     lubridate::month(date) %in% 4:7 ~ "04050607",     lubridate::month(date) %in% 8:11 ~ "08091011",     lubridate::month(date) %in% c(12,1,2,3) ~ "12010203"   ) ) ducks <- dplyr::filter(sscf_occs_area, code_id %in% (species_ref |>   dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(group, "duck")) |>   dplyr::pull(code_id) |>   unique())) |> dplyr::distinct() library(stars) # Create reference grid grid <- terra::rast(area, resolution = 200) q95 <- terra::rasterize(terra::vect(ducks), grid, field = "abondance", fun = quantile, probs = c(0.95), by = "season") tmap::tmap_mode("view") #> ℹ tmap mode set to "view". tmap::tm_basemap(tmap::providers$CartoDB.DarkMatter) +   tmap::tm_shape(log10(q95)) +   tmap::tm_raster() +   tmap::tm_facets(ncol = 2) +   tmap::tm_layout(title = c("Printemps-Été", "Été-Automne", "Hiver"))  #> [v3->v4] `tm_layout()`: use `tm_title()` instead of #> `tm_layout(title = )` #> [scale] tm_raster:() the data variable assigned to 'col' contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set 'midpoint = NA' in 'fill.scale = tm_scale_intervals(<HERE>)' to use all visual values (e.g. colors) #>  #> [scale] tm_raster:() the data variable assigned to 'col' contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set 'midpoint = NA' in 'fill.scale = tm_scale_intervals(<HERE>)' to use all visual values (e.g. colors) #>  #> [scale] tm_raster:() the data variable assigned to 'col' contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set 'midpoint = NA' in 'fill.scale = tm_scale_intervals(<HERE>)' to use all visual values (e.g. colors) #> Error in if (title != "") {: the condition has length > 1 duck_seasons <- ducks |>   dplyr::group_split(season)  densities_rs <- duck_seasons |> purrr::map(\(df){   df_ppp <- spatstat.geom::as.ppp(df)   density <- spatstat.explore::density.ppp(df_ppp, sigma = 1)    # Go back to terra::rast   density <- terra::rast(density)   terra::crs(density) <- "epsg:32198"    # Resample on based grid   terra::resample(density, grid, method = "near") })  # Remove negative densities and mask values densities_rs <- purrr::map(densities_rs, \(r){   # r <- terra::clamp(r, lower = 0, upper = Inf, values = FALSE)   r <- terra::mask(r, area)   r }) |>   terra::rast() |>   setNames(c("Printemps-Été", "Été-Automne", "Hiver"))  tmap::tmap_mode("view") #> ℹ tmap mode set to "view". tmap::tm_basemap(tmap::providers$CartoDB.DarkMatter) +   tmap::tm_shape(densities_rs) +   tmap::tm_raster(title = "Kernel density estimation", palette = viridis::viridis(12)) +   tmap::tm_facets(ncol = 2, free.scales = TRUE) +   tmap::tm_layout(title = c("Printemps-Été", "Été-Automne", "Hiver")) #> [v3->v4] `tm_tm_raster()`: migrate the argument(s) related to the #> scale of the visual variable `col` namely 'palette' (rename to #> 'values') to col.scale = tm_scale(<HERE>). #> [v3->v4] `tm_raster()`: migrate the argument(s) related to the #> legend of the visual variable `col` namely 'title' to 'col.legend #> = tm_legend(<HERE>)' #> tm_facets(): the argument free.scales is deprecated. Specify this via the layer functions (e.g. fill.free in tm_polygons) #>  #> [v3->v4] `tm_layout()`: use `tm_title()` instead of #> `tm_layout(title = )` #> Error in if (title != "") {: the condition has length > 1

code: @Manual{,   title = {urgenceAviR: urgenceAviR},   author = {Matthieu Beaumont and {inSileco}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {http://insileco.io/urgenceAviR/}, }

title: urgenceAviR
text: Un package conçu pour rassembler et intégrer des relevés d’oiseaux. Il facilite l’exploration interactive des données et l’évaluation des menaces pesant sur les populations d’oiseaux aquatiques au Québec à la suite d’un incident de déversement.

title: urgenceAviR
code: # Installer devtools si ce n'est pas déjà fait install.packages("devtools")  # Installer urgenceAviR depuis GitHub devtools::install_github("insileco/urgenceAviR")

title: urgenceAviR
text: L’application peut être lancée selon trois modes différents:

what: Mode 1: Local avec dossier de données préconfiguré
title: urgenceAviR
text: Utilisez ce mode pour travailler en local avec un dossier de données spécifique:
code: # Définir le dossier contenant les fichiers de données urgenceAviR::set_datasets_folder("path/to/files")  # Lancer l'application urgenceAviR::run_app()

what: Mode 2: Local avec configuration du dossier de données (production)
title: urgenceAviR
text: Utilisez ce mode pour un déploiement local en production où le dossier de données est configuré dans inst/golem-config.yml:
code: # Activer le mode production Sys.setenv(R_CONFIG_ACTIVE = "production")  # Lancer l'application sans téléversement de fichiers urgenceAviR::run_app(file_upload = FALSE)

what: Mode 3: Cloud avec téléversement de fichiers
title: urgenceAviR
text: Utilisez ce mode pour un déploiement cloud où les utilisateurs téléversent leurs propres fichiers: Note: La taille maximale des fichiers téléversés est de 250 MB.
code: # Activer le mode production Sys.setenv(R_CONFIG_ACTIVE = "production")  # Lancer l'application avec téléversement de fichiers urgenceAviR::run_app()

title: urgenceAviR
text: Une fois le dossier de données configuré avec set_datasets_folder(), vous pouvez charger les données de deux façons :

what: Charger tous les jeux de données
title: urgenceAviR
code: # Charger et combiner tous les jeux de données en un seul data.frame all_data <- urgenceAviR::load_all_datasets()  # Ou charger les jeux de données séparément dans une liste datasets_list <- urgenceAviR::load_all_datasets(combine = FALSE)

what: Charger un jeu de données spécifique
title: urgenceAviR
text: Vous pouvez également charger les jeux de données individuellement :
code: # Charger les canards de mer canards <- urgenceAviR::load_canards()  # Charger les eiders en hiver eiders <- urgenceAviR::load_eider_hiver()  # Charger les garrots garrots <- urgenceAviR::load_garrot()  # Charger les macreuses macreuses <- urgenceAviR::load_macreuse()  # Charger les oies oies <- urgenceAviR::load_oies()  # Charger la sauvagine du fleuve sauvagine <- urgenceAviR::load_sauvagine_fleuve()  # Charger SOMEC somec <- urgenceAviR::load_somec()  # Charger BIOMQ biomq <- urgenceAviR::load_biomq()  # Charger les îles du Nunavik iles <- urgenceAviR::load_iles_nunavik()  # Charger l'inventaire aérien du Nunavik inventaire <- urgenceAviR::load_inventaire_aerien_nunavik()  # Charger les colonies atlantiques atlantic <- urgenceAviR::load_atlantic_colonies()

title: urgenceAviR
text: Le package intègre les jeux de données suivants :

title: Retrieve eBird Data — get_ebird
text: Filters retrieves data eBird GeoDatabase file (.gdb) using SQL query.

title: Retrieve eBird Data — get_ebird
code: get_ebird(   path = NULL,   species = NULL,   year = NULL,   month = NULL,   extent = NULL,   ... )

title: Retrieve eBird Data — get_ebird
text: path Character string specifying file path eBird GeoDatabase file (.gdb). NULL, uses default path external_files()$ebird_data$path. species Character vector species names filter (e.g., "Snow Goose"). NULL, query filter species. year Integer vector years filter (e.g., 2012:2014). NULL, query filter year. month Integer vector months filter (e.g., 4:5). NULL, query filter year . extent sf terra spatial object defining spatial extent filter data. NULL, query apply spatial filtering. ... Additional arguments passed SQL query construction function (compose_query). allows customization query conditions.

title: Retrieve eBird Data — get_ebird
text: SpatVector object containing filtered eBird data.

title: Retrieve eBird Data — get_ebird
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example: Retrieve data for Snow Goose in April and May of 2012-2014 get_ebird(   path = "path/to/ebird.gdb",   species = "Snow Goose",   year = 2012:2014,   month = 4:5 )  # Using default path from external_files get_ebird(species = "Snow Goose", year = 2020) } # }

Load and process all datasets — load_all_datasets

Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run Shiny Application

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = "url",   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, otherwise passed options argument. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". equivalent calling enableBookmarking() function just prior calling shinyApp(). default value, NULL, app respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See ?golem::get_golem_options details.

title: Set datasets folder path — set_datasets_folder
text: Set datasets folder path

title: Set datasets folder path — set_datasets_folder
Set datasets folder path — set_datasets_folder
text: path Path datasets folder (must end "/")

title: Taxonomy Reference Table — taxonomy
text: reference table combining avian core data (French/Latin names) taxonomy vulnerability data (milieu_marin, groupe_fonctionnel). dataset used internally load_* functions enrich bird observation data taxonomic information.

title: Taxonomy Reference Table — taxonomy
Taxonomy Reference Table — taxonomy
text: data frame 2474 rows 6 variables: code_id Species ID code (character) nom_francais French common name (character) nom_latin Scientific/Latin name (character) milieu_marin Marine habitat indicator (character) groupe_fonctionnel Functional group classification (character) code_fr Normalized French name code matching (character)

title: Taxonomy Reference Table — taxonomy
text: Environment Climate Change Canada (ECCC) Avian Core Database

title: Taxonomy Reference Table — taxonomy
text: dataset automatically loaded package loaded. generated two source files: ECCC_Avian_Core_20241025.csv - Contains species IDs, French Latin names taxo_vulnerabilite.csv - Contains marine habitat functional group data dataset built using data-raw/build_taxonomy.R script, joins processes source data.

title: Taxonomy Reference Table — taxonomy
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Access the taxonomy dataset head(taxonomy)  # Filter by marine habitat marine_birds <- taxonomy[taxonomy$milieu_marin == "Oui", ]  # Find a specific species taxonomy[taxonomy$code_id == "MALL", ] } # }

title: urgenceAviR: urgenceAviR — urgenceAviR-package
text: Un package conçu pour rassembler et intégrer les relevés d'oiseaux. La nouvelle base de données créée est utilisée pour évaluer le niveau de menace environnementale lors d'incident.

title: urgenceAviR: urgenceAviR — urgenceAviR-package
text: Maintainer: inSileco info@insileco.io Authors: Matthieu Beaumont matthieu.beaumont@ec.gc.ca contributors: Clara Casabona [contributor]
